fields.headline: BA offers free children's tickets
fields.bodyText: British Airways is giving away free children's flights in a joint promotion with Odeon cinemas that includes services over Christmas and the February half-term. Every adult watching a family film (U or PG rated) at an Odeon will qualify for a free child flight if they book by December 12. The offer applies to all short-haul and more than 30 long-haul destinations. Based on a family of two adults and two children, the saving on a flight to Orlando, Florida, over Christmas is £910 from the normal total fare of £2,520. Similarly, a flight to Paris over the February half-term would cost £250, a saving of £138. The offer for children aged between two and 11 applies to flights up to April 7. The routes excluded from the offer are India, Jeddah, Sydney, Melbourne, Bangkok and Singapore.
